ReviewList.Text: This is a great series. The first book had the title Fatherless. It was also a great book. I am waiting for the third one in the series. This series is about the not too distant future. 2042. It is about the demographic changes that may occur due to society changing. The implication is that marriage is not important anymore and that our elderly population has outgrown the young population. There are not enough jobs to go around and life is not as easy as it once was. It is a time of selfishness. Women are more interested in their careers than in childbirth. It is a time when there are transition centers where the elderly or disabled may go and transition (die) so that their worldly goods may be given to their loved ones. There is a lot of abuse in this. I don't know, you will have to read it and come to your own conclusions. It is very close to that time now and I am not looking forward to that kind of future. I hope we can make a difference now.

Second in a series by James Dobson and Kurt Bruner, and just as riveting as the first book.  A look into the future at a world with designer babies and guilting seniors and handicapped persons into euthanasia, for the good of their family.  Can't wait to read the final book in the trilogy.
Just as I expected.... has me on the edge of m seat waiting for Godless. I love everything about this series!
After reading Fatherless I couldn't wait for this second book to come out. It's even better than the first. I would definitely recommend this to a friend.
Great read! The authors have made the story and characters in such a way that your mind automatically applies to ongoing events on its own.

I am loving this series of books.  I read FATHERLESS and then ordered CHILDLESS and am looking forward to GODLESS coming out in the Spring.  A very thought provoking series.  I highly recommend all three.
A Chilling look into the future of America if we continue on the course we are now following.  Read all three!

I am an avid reader and I have read thousands of books, this was awesome. It covered every emotion a family could go thru. I have been through each personally. It proves the human spirit can recover and go on with the help of our Lord and each other. I love the book.

Dobson and Bruner really pulled it off! Only about thirty years in the future, we see the consequences of some globally ignorant attitudes about the value of children. Anyone who has raised children, or who is mature enough to have observed being raised, know that children are a burden. Much sacrifice is involved, but the rewards far outweigh the burden. Children are a gift from God in His amazing plan for our world, a burden to be cherished.
Excellent for recreational reading. Fantastic study of future events that are going to happen. Looking forward to the final book in the trilogy.
I read the book and was disturbed that this could happen in our future world. Easy read and would recommend it as a possibility in our world the way it is going.
Fatherless was a great book and now I'm enjoying Childless. Looking forward to Godless. Eye-opening series. This topic needs to be a discussion in our country.
Scary how possible this could become with the people we have in government and the regulations that are beginning to put in place!

This novel is gripping and thought provoking in a way that you can't put it down. You pray it won't really happen in the future but in actuality he shows how it could become our future. I felt challenged and empowered after reading this book. Thank you Dr. Dobson for never disappointing. Keep the novels coming your gift is far reaching indeed.
it reminds us of what could be if our culture keeps going in the direction that it is.it is highly recommended.
The story is plausible, the characters are realistic. I was hooked with Fatherless, had to read this book. Was hoping the story was continued....
Thought provoking. I enjoyed the forward-thinking perspective that follows current social trends to their inevitable end 20 - 30 years from now.
The plot line is really good, I think it's something we really need to be watching out for, however I would have given the 5th star if the dialoges were more believable.
It is interesting to think about and scary to look around and see the trend is really going in this direction.

I found this book OK but lacking the "oomph" of Fatherless. The characters we came to care about in the first book are not the primary ones in the second. The new ones introduced did not touch my heart.
Just think of what will become of our society if this book is accurate about birth rates???  Without children, who will take care of all those "debit" elderly, who by the way, will be you!!!!??????
wonderful!! thought provoking, points us to the realities of our world and our only Hope.. take the time to read and enjoy this!
This book is a good read with a chilling message of where our nation will be if it continues to be selfish.
Best series ever....a must read...for Christians and across then board....it is an eye opener.
Better than the first installment Fatherless.  Looking forward to the 3rd ..... Godless

Imagine a world where sex is a recreational activity, marriage is passé, procreation is engineered, and euthanasia is the status quo for the elderly or disabled. The population is aging, the workforce is dwindling and the economy is plummeting out of control. It's a society that worships the idols of sex, success, youth, money, status and power. This exciting novel will have you cheering for the faithful and fearing for your future

Following on the heals of the first book of this trilogy, Fatherless, Julia Davidson Simmons continous her research into the transition industry. Many interesting twists along the path. Wainting impatiently for book three.
With everything going on in our nation right now, I am left to wonder how far this book is from reality.  Another great story that leaves the reader ready to pick up the third book and get started!

This was a good follow up to Fatherless but not quite as good because I felt that they focus on the detective too much but it was much needed for the events that are going to happen in the book. I think this book is a great set up for the next one. The reading was thrilling and is a page turner.
Insightful and thought provoking read of our probable culture.

The book picked up a little after where the last one stopped. Extremely captivating, I read it in one day. Very scary at times. You sympathize with main characters (Julia/Troy) a lot. I always loved Dr. Dobson's writings, and this one definitely didn't disappoint.
Great writing.  Worth reading.  Dr Dobson has done a great job with his first series of books.  This is book 2.  Can't wait for the third book.

Very simple book and so easy to read. I read the first book in the series of three, FATHERLESS,  and will read the last book when it comes out.  The storyline is easily understood even if you haven't read number one but I encourage everyone to get the first book anyway.  If you enjoy growing with the protagonists in books, you will find good character depth from the beginning.  The only deficit is that since I read an average of 100+ books each year, I saw the story "coming down the road"
Good sequel.
Thank you!
Great authors tell a captivating  story.  Although I value Dr. Dobson's Christian emphasis, his storytelling does not capture the reader.

This is a very interesting novel and captures the readers interest. Keeps one wanting to see what happens next. Paints a very dark picture of America's future with a few bright spots. I personally think we will never see this come to pass. Yahshua will rapture His people. the tribulation will be history, and we will be living in the Millenium (thousand year reign of Messiah.) If I am wrong about this get ready for the things depicted in this book. That's where we are headed.
